meanings.definition: Conceals one's true motives, feelings, or beliefs
meanings.sent1: She dissembles her disappointment with a smile.
meanings.sent2: He often dissembles his fear to appear brave.
meanings.sent3: The magician dissembles his tricks to keep the audience guessing.
meanings.sent4: The politician dissembles his intentions to gain more votes.
meanings.sent5: The spy dissembles his identity to blend in seamlessly.

meanings.sent1: The child dissembles illness to avoid going to school.
meanings.sent2: She dissembles interest in the topic to avoid further discussion.
meanings.sent3: The actor dissembles a terrible dancer in the play for comedic effect.
meanings.sent4: He dissembles happiness even when feeling sad inside.
meanings.sent5: The student dissembles understanding to avoid embarrassment.

meanings.sent1: The chameleon dissembles itself to blend into its surroundings.
meanings.sent2: The criminal dissembles his true identity to evade capture.
meanings.sent3: The artist dissembles imperfections in the painting with skillful strokes.
meanings.sent4: The mask dissembles the wearer's true emotions.
meanings.sent5: The fog dissembles the view of the distant mountains.
